protocol_name: The method to measure one side surface area of the seaweed
protocol_name_html: The method to measure one side surface area of the seaweed
protocol_affiliation: Institute of Oceanology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Qingdao

authors_list.name: XU MIN
authors_list.affiliation: Institute of Oceanology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Qingdao

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Collect seaweed samples from the field
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Collect seaweed samples from the field

components.data: During each survey, scuba divers randomly sampled ca. 20–40 S. horneri.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: During each survey, scuba divers randomly sampled ca. 20–40 S. horneri.

components.data: Thalli collected by the divers were numbered individually and transported to a laboratory where the weight of each of them were determined. Samples were kept at −30°C until analysis.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Thalli collected by the divers were numbered individually and transported to a laboratory where the weight of each of them were determined. Samples were kept at −30°C until analysis.

components.data: Measure the weight of the samples
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Measure the weight of the samples

components.data: We used a balance (CR-5000WP, Custom) to determine wet weights of the thalli (±2 g) after absorbing surface water with a paper towel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We used a balance (CR-5000WP, Custom) to determine wet weights of the thalli (±2 g) after absorbing surface water with a paper towel.

components.data: Measure one side surface area of the samples
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Measure one side surface area of the samples

components.data: One-sided surface area was measured using ImageJ 6.4 software (National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, MD, USA; http://imagej.nih.gov/ij) by converting the pixels corresponding to the thallus on a digital photograph with a 30-cm ruler scaled to an area using a calibration equation obtained from the square of a known area (5 × 5 cm). We prepared five photographs of each individual that were connected horizontally using image processing software (Photoshop CS; Adobe Systems Inc., San Jose, CA, USA). The mean of the five calculated areas was used as the one-sided surface area of a thallus.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: One-sided surface area was measured using ImageJ 6.4 software (National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, MD, USA; http://imagej.nih.gov/ij) by converting the pixels corresponding to the thallus on a digital photograph with a 30-cm ruler scaled to an area using a calibration equation obtained from the square of a known area (5 × 5 cm). We prepared five photographs of each individual that were connected horizontally using image processing software (Photoshop CS; Adobe Systems Inc., San Jose, CA, USA). The mean of the five calculated areas was used as the one-sided surface area of a thallus.
